subject: Pedal Control Box
description_text:
Good Morning,

I recently purchased a new pedal box for the pro x ultra, as my last one
stopped reading the position of the pedals accurately. When the new one
arrived I got it installed and it fixed the problem. I purchased the new
box on August 26th, the box started giving me issues yesterday and it's the
same problems as the old box. I was wondering if the box falls under
warranty. I was also wondering if this is a common issue? Order number is
SSN2452. Any help is greatly appreciated!

conversations.body_text: Hi Chris Romero,    Since you did not provide an email address, you did not receive the shipping notification. Here is your logistics tracking link.  https://t.17track.net/en#nums=SF6045874990142
ID 为 3138 的工单已合并到此工单。

合并来自工单3138  
      主题: Order Confirmation  
      描述:  Hello,  
 I recently purchased the control box on Sunday. I haven’t seen any updates or received an order confirmation yet. It is for Chris Romero, going to 1006 N Murray Blvd Colorado Springs Co. I was just wanting to see if I could get an update?

Hi Chris Romero,    Please make sure your SIMSONN Manager is updated to version 2.1.0. Then follow the steps below:    Open the software and go to Settings → Update, then click Check for Updates.    Check if the ProX firmware can be updated to version 2.0.3.    If no automatic update is available, please use Manual Update: Path: Settings → Update → Manual Update Firmware → pedals → firmware → pedals-prox.sfu.    After the update, please test again.    If the issue persists, try reconnecting the USB and power cable, then test again.    If it still doesn’t work, please send me a screenshot of the software interface so I can check further for you.

Hello,

The software is updated to 2.1.0. There is no auto update so I try the
manual update and when I click on the  prox.sfu it says “the file is not an
upgrade file for the pedal”

On Wed, Sep 24, 2025 at 9:11 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi Chris Romero,    You can try selecting proxultra.sfu.

That worked, I appreciate it! Just out of curiosity, should that fix the
problem from here on out. Or will I need to do that again in the future?

On Wed, Sep 24, 2025 at 7:36 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Chris Romero, You can continue to use it for now. If you encounter this issue again, it indicates that it is a software bug. We will quickly identify the cause and fix it.
